item.title: 美元本月最大涨幅带动全球货币下滑
item.description: 随着交易商重新考虑唐纳德-特朗普可能重返白宫的影响，美元汇率创下本月最大涨幅。【原文：The dollar is surging by the most this month as traders reconsider the effect of Donald Trump’s potential return to the White House.】

item.title: 据说巴西 Sabesp 公司将以 27 亿美元的价格私有化
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，巴西最富有、人口最多的圣保罗州将通过巨额股票发行放弃对水务公司 Sabesp 的控制权。【原文：The state of Sao Paulo, Brazil’s richest and most populous, is giving up control of water utility Sabesp in a jumbo stock offering, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 布鲁克菲尔德注册新经纪商，推动信贷发展
item.description: 布鲁克菲尔德资产管理公司（Brookfield Asset Management）成立了一家新的美国经纪交易商，作为该公司扩大其 3,000 亿美元信贷业务计划的一部分。【原文：Brookfield Asset Management set up a new US broker-dealer as part of the firm’s plan to expand its $300 billion credit business.】

item.title: 法国议员再次选举中间派人士为议长
item.description: 法国立法者再次选举埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）所在政党的中间派候选人连任国民议会议长，这表明总统的联盟可能是上个月总统解散立法机构后组建新政府的最佳人选。【原文：French lawmakers reelected the centrist candidate from Emmanuel Macron’s party to a second term leading the National Assembly in a sign the president’s coalition may be best placed to form a new government after he dissolved the legislature last month.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州最大养老基金将从私募股权基金撤资近 100 亿美元
item.description: 得克萨斯州最大的公共养老基金已决定从私募股权投资中撤资近 100 亿美元，这是对该资产类别的一次打击，因为该资产类别在回报减少和投资组合公司退出放缓的情况下面临着更严格的审查。【原文：Texas’ largest public pension fund has decided to shift almost $10 billion out of private equity investments, a blow to an asset class that has faced heightened scrutiny amid dwindling returns and a slowdown in exits for portfolio companies.】

item.title: 老牌 SPAC 赞助商在短短六周内推动了 17 亿美元的增长
item.description: 迈克尔-安德雷蒂（Michael Andretti）、霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）和詹姆斯-格拉夫（James Graf）等连续赞助商重返美国空头支票市场。【原文：Michael Andretti, Howard Lutnick and James Graf are among the serial sponsors returning to a US blank-check market that’s been heating up over the past six weeks, with mostly seasoned backers attracting $1.7 billion between them.】

item.title: 德国肖尔茨为与塞尔维亚的锂矿交易计划辩护
item.description: 德国总理奥拉夫-肖尔茨（Olaf Scholz）为计划中的与塞尔维亚的锂矿交易辩护，称采矿项目不会对该地区的环境造成负面影响。【原文：German Chancellor Olaf Scholz defended a planned Lithium deal with Serbia and said that the mining project will not have a negative effect on the region’s environment.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚获得国际货币基金组织（IMF）新贷款的关键融资保证
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，埃塞俄比亚的官方债权人已经向该国提供了融资保证，以帮助国际货币基金组织执行董事会快速批准一笔新贷款。【原文：Ethiopia’s official creditors have granted financing assurances to the country to help fast-track approval of a new loan by the International Monetary Fund’s executive board, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Antares 着眼于欧洲私人信贷交易以扩大规模
item.description: Antares Capital 是一家总部位于美国的私人信贷公司，管理着 600 多亿美元的资产，该公司正在考虑在欧洲进行潜在收购，作为其发展战略的一部分。【原文：Antares Capital, a US-based private credit firm overseeing more than $60 billion in assets, is considering a potential acquisition in Europe as part of its growth strategy.】

item.title: Ardent Health 1.92 亿美元首次公开募股规模缩小后股价下跌 4.1
item.description: Ardent Health Partners Inc. 在首次公开募股中募集了 1.92 亿美元，但募股规模较原计划有所缩减，定价也低于市场预期范围，上市首日股价下跌了 4.1%。【原文：Ardent Health Partners Inc. shares declined 4.1% in their trading debut, after raising $192 million in an initial public offering that was reduced from its proposed size and priced below a marketed range.】

item.title: 巴拿马承诺在未来数月内与第一量子公司就已关闭的矿山进行商谈
item.description: 巴拿马政府表示，将在未来几个月内与第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）接触，讨论其关闭的铜矿对环境造成的影响。【原文：Panama’s government says it will engage with First Quantum Minerals Ltd. in the coming months to discuss the environmental impact of its shuttered copper mine.】

item.title: 多伦多公寓开发商迎来 27 年来最低新单元销售量
item.description: 尽管住房短缺，但高利率抑制了需求，多伦多公寓开发商的新单元销售速度降至 27 年来最慢。【原文：Toronto’s condominium developers saw sales of new units fall to the slowest pace in 27 years as high interest rates temper demand despite a shortage of housing.】

item.title: 欧洲央行官员考虑 2024 年是否只能再降息一次
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，欧洲中央银行的决策者们越来越怀疑他们今年是否只能再降息一次。【原文：European Central Bank policymakers are increasingly wondering if they may only be able to cut interest rates once more this year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 私人信贷深入华尔街避之不及的风险领域
item.description: 规模达 1.7 万亿美元的私人信贷业正致力于将自己改造成世界上的新银行，并对向负债公司提供贷款的风险表现出越来越大的容忍度。【原文：The $1.7 trillion private credit industry is set on transforming itself into the world’s new banks, and it’s putting on display an ever greater tolerance for the risks of lending to indebted companies.】

item.title: 英国对运输俄罗斯石油的油轮船队实施更多制裁
item.description: 英国又对 11 艘帮助俄罗斯向客户出口供应的油轮实施了制裁，其中包括一些属于影子船队的油轮。【原文：The UK placed sanctions on 11 more oil tankers that are helping Russia to export its supplies to customers, including some that are part of a shadow-fleet.】

item.title: 尼日利亚向经销商提供美元以缩小货币汇率差距
item.description: 尼日利亚中央银行正在向货币兑换商提供美元，并对他们出售美元的汇率设置上限，以关闭官方市场和平行市场中不断扩大的币值。【原文：Nigeria’s central bank is offering dollars to money changers and is capping the rate at which they can sell the US currency to close the widening values in the official and parallel markets.】

item.title: 自由港液化天然气公司在贝里尔飓风中断后取消至少 10 批货物运输
item.description: 据熟悉内情的交易商称，在飓风贝里尔迫使德克萨斯州自由港液化天然气出口终端关闭后，该终端已取消了至少 10 批货物在 8 月份之前的装船计划。【原文：The Freeport liquefied natural gas export terminal in Texas has canceled at least 10 cargoes for loading through August after Hurricane Beryl forced the facility to shut, according to traders familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 发现新城疫病毒后巴西鸡肉供应商业绩下滑
item.description: 在一个商业农场发现一种致命的家禽疾病后，巴西的鸡肉生产下滑，引发了对世界最大出口国实施贸易禁运的担忧。【原文：Brazil chicken producers slumped after a virulent poultry disease was found on a commercial farm, prompting fears of trade embargoes against the world’s largest exporter.】

item.title: 是什么引发了孟加拉国学生的致命抗议？
item.description: 据媒体报道，孟加拉国学生要求取消政府工作配额制度的抗议活动持续数周，最终演变成与警察和反抗议者的暴力冲突，造成至少 15 人死亡，数十人受伤。【原文：Weeks of protests by students in Bangladesh demanding the removal of a quota system for government jobs have spiralled into violent clashes with police and counter-protesters, leaving at least 15 people dead and scores injured, according to media reports.】

item.title: 德国被指控囤积用于供应捷克的天然气
item.description: 捷克指责德国囤积天然气，削减了一条出口管道的输送能力，而该地区正在努力取代俄罗斯的天然气供应。【原文：The Czech Republic accused Germany of hoarding gas by slashing the capacity of an export pipeline just as the region grapples with replacing supplies from Russia.】

item.title: 挪威领导人称美国总统都不想放弃乌克兰
item.description: 挪威首相表示，他不认为美国总统会撤回对乌克兰的支持或放弃北约，因为北约防务联盟对所有成员都有利。【原文：Norway’s prime minister said he doesn’t see any US President pulling its support for Ukraine or abandoning NATO as the defense alliance benefits all its members.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行坚决支持对欧盟财政规则的约束
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行坚决支持欧盟推动负债国的预算政策与该地区的财政规则保持一致。【原文：The European Central Bank firmly backs the European Union’s push to bring budget policies in indebted nations in line with the region’s fiscal rules, President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: Calpers 的弗罗斯特说，埃克森的裂痕显示了 "勇敢 "的机会
item.description: 美国最大的养老金—加州公务员退休系统—和埃克森美孚公司之间的公开争斗可能才刚刚开始。【原文：The public battle between the largest U.S. pension — California Public Employees’ Retirement System — and Exxon Mobil Corp. may be just the beginning.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长金多斯希望西班牙在 9 月任命新行长
item.description: 欧洲中央银行副行长路易斯-德金多斯（Luis de Guindos）表示，他希望西班牙政府能在 9 月前任命一位新的央行行长。【原文：European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said he hopes the Spanish government will appoint a new central bank chief by September.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行不久将启动政策战略评估
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行将 "合理地尽快 "开始研究其货币政策战略，预计明年下半年会有结果。【原文：The European Central Bank will “reasonably soon” start looking into its monetary-policy strategy — with results expected in the second half of next year, President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行 9 月利率会议将 "大开大合
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行的下一次利率会议将是 "大开大合 "的，尽管决策者们将掌握更多的信息来决定是否需要再次降息。【原文：The European Central Bank’s next interest-rate meeting will be “wide open,” though policymakers will have significantly more information on which to decide whether another cut is warranted, according to President Christine Lagarde.】

item.title: 土耳其讨好投资者的货币政策在国内遭到批评
item.description: 高利率和可预测货币的组合使土耳其成为外国投资者异常安全的赌注，但随着出口商业务流失和经济放缓，对这种组合的批评也越来越多。【原文：A combination of high interest rates and a predictable currency have made Turkey an unusually safe bet for foreign investors, but criticism of that mix is growing as exporters lose business and the economy slows.】

item.title: 据说阿达尼和威尔玛将为出售合资公司股权挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，阿达尼企业有限公司（Adani Enterprises Ltd.）和威尔玛国际有限公司（Wilmar International Ltd.）已选择银行帮助出售其消费合资企业阿达尼威尔玛有限公司（Adani Wilmar Ltd.）的少数股权。【原文：Adani Enterprises Ltd. and Wilmar International Ltd. have selected banks to help with the sale of a minority stake in their consumer joint venture Adani Wilmar Ltd., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英国金币销量因对工党财政计划的担忧而飙升
item.description: 由于投资者担心新一届工党政府可能会改变财政政策，英国皇家造币厂有限公司的免税金币销售量在上一季度大幅攀升。【原文：Sales of tax-exempt gold coins by the UK’s Royal Mint Ltd. jumped in the last quarter as investors fretted about potential changes to fiscal policy by an expected new Labour government.】

item.title: 南非央行维持关键利率不变，双方意见不一
item.description: 南非央行继续维持利率不变，理由是对通货膨胀的担忧挥之不去。【原文：South Africa’s central bank kept interest rates on hold, citing lingering concerns about inflation.】
